page.title: 12BLACKO MILL
page.content: {PETER REED}is the owner of the mill. The mill produces high quality cotton fabric for bed linen. He started his business in 1959 although there has been a mill in {BLACKO}for over 100 years. The mill was re-equipped in 1968 and each year new machinery is introduced. New looms are being added this year - bought in {BELGIUM}- { No{TEXTILE MACHINERY }produced in Britain.{EMPLOYMENT}is provided for sixty people at the mill, few live in the village, most travel from Nelson. Raw cotton comes from{EGYPT.}Mr. Reed gets a lot of trade from{NEW ZEALAND, {AMERICA,AUSTRALIA}and{THE MIDDLE EAST. People in The Middle East order a lot of bright green sheets with yellow embroidery.The bedding produced is the sort to be used at{BUCKINGHAM PALACE and{10,DOWNING STREET,}it is also sold at {HARRODS }and other big stores.
